# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is a Julia function that wraps a string into lines based on a given text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= isempty(current_line) ? word : " $word"
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string into lines with a maximum width of 10 characters like this:

```julia
s = "This function will wrap words into lines"
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will output:

```
This function
will wrap
words into
lines
```
